bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Archaeology and text in the investigation of households and families in Roman Egypt. - Towards a closer dialog about the domestic sphere: Continuity and change in households at Karanis. - Conclusion: Archaeology and text, family and household.

bibl.title: A Companion to Families in the Greek and Roman Worlds

bibl.seg: Nevett Lisa, Family and Household, Ancient History and Archaeology: A Case Study from Roman Egypt.
Beryl Rawson (Ed.), A Companion to Families in the Greek and Roman Worlds = Blackwell Companions to the Ancient World. Ancient History (Malden, MA - Oxford, 2011) pp. 15-31, 4 figg.

1. Introduction. - 2. Archaeology and text in the investigation of households and families in Roman Egypt. - Towards a closer dialog about the domestic sphere: Continuity and change in households at Karanis. - Conclusion: Archaeology and text, family and household.
